replies.msg:
Couldn't agree more. That's why Uncle Siu and also some other KOLs are the ultimate bad example - the more he fakes his so called british accent (which it obviously isn't) the worse the english learning culture in HK will be. I have met countless HK people who think he speaks brilliantly, which is extremely sad. (That's why he nailed so many TV commericals anyway). That guy is, imo, a disgrace to all the hard- working english teachers out there.

P.S. I was partially referring to Kongish, but not necessarily. There are people (even in both lihkg and golden) who do not accept that they suck, i'ts just the "accent"'s fault. A commonly seen argument is that they think foreigners (e.g. indians) speak english really badly, but the fact is that most indian can speak very fluently, just with a thick accent, but most HK people cannot articulate their opinions and feelings in english without er er er er x 1000.
